cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 10 miles WSW of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward just offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast and then toward Nova Scotia

weather_observation.warning_coast: North Carolina/Virginia border to Fenwick Island DE (including lower Chesapeake Bay and southern tidal Potomac)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mid-Atlantic shoreline from North Carolina through Delaware and southern New Jersey, extending to southeastern New England
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds of 35–40 mph possible Friday afternoon and evening as the outer circulation brushes the Delaware coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding of 1–2 ft possible in Delaware Bay, but surge not expected to exceed 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could deliver 1–2 inches of rain; flooding threat low.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents likely along Delaware beaches, brief marine restrictions on the Delaware River.
